pattern chart 5 1 introduction the golden vermillion necessaire is a charming mini colorwork project designed to make the most of scrap yarns born from the simple need for a compact organizer in my handbag to keep my comb mirror travel-sized moisturizer and lipstick neatly separated this little pouch combines functionality with beautiful traditional chinese colour aesthetics the size of the sample is 12cm width × 15cm length the pouch is constructed top-down in the round using three distinct sections 1 first a practical drawstring casing is created through stockinette knitting with strategically placed yarn-over eyelets which are then joined to the cast-on edge to form the drawstring channel 2 second the body features an elegant plaid colorwork pattern in golden yellow and vermillion red 3 the bottom is seamlessly closed using the kitchener stitch technique for a polished finish 1 1 materials and gauge sample specifications yarn novita nalle 80% wool 20% polyamide 260m/100g colors yellow and red approximately 15g each needles 2 5mm double-pointed knitting needles gauge 25 stitches × 28 row = 10cm × 10cm in colorwork yarn suggestions any sport to dk weight yarn approximately 260m/100g will achieve similar results however since this is a scrap-busting project for a simple pouch feel free to adjust your gauge and final dimensions based on whatever leftover yarns you have on hand 2 © hanxiao zhou all rights reserved 1 2 key techniques yarn over for creating drawstring eyelets knit 2 stitches together for shaping and joining kitchener stitch for seamlessly closing the bottom 2 instructions 2 1 cast-on using yellow yarn cast on 60 stitches and distribute evenly across 4 double-pointed needles 15 stitches per needle i ii iii and iv join to work in the round being careful not to twist note the chart figure 1 pattern chart demonstrates the knitting pattern for needles i and ii only as the patterns on needles iii and iv are identical 2 2 drawstring casing follow the chart figure 1 pattern chart from row 1-18 to create the drawstring casing with eyelets creating the casing after completing row 18 you ll join the working stitches to the cast-on edge to form the drawstring channel 1 pull the cast-on edge up from inside the needles keeping the eyelet side facing outward 2 place one cast-on stitch onto the left needle next to each
